meanings.sent1: The old broken toys were just rammel to the children.
meanings.sent2: The garage was full of rammel that needed to be thrown away.
meanings.sent3: He tried to sell his rammel at the yard sale, but no one was interested.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was cluttered with rammel thoughts that she couldn't shake off.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house was filled with rammel, making it look eerie and neglected.

meanings.definition: To fill with useless or unwanted material.
meanings.sent1: She would rammel the box with old newspapers to use as padding.
meanings.sent2: The kids would rammel the sandcastle with seashells and seaweed.
meanings.sent3: He decided to rammel the essay with unnecessary details to make it longer.
meanings.sent4: The overflowing trash can was rammelled with discarded food wrappers.
meanings.sent5: The cluttered desk was rammelled with random pens and paper clips.

meanings.definition: To talk or write at length in a confused or inconsequential way.
meanings.sent1: She would rammel on about her day, not realizing no one was listening.
meanings.sent2: The professor would often rammel during his lectures, losing the students' attention.
meanings.sent3: He would rammel in his sleep, mumbling incoherent words.
meanings.sent4: The politician would rammel on stage, trying to avoid answering the questions.
meanings.sent5: Her mind would rammel with thoughts, making it hard to focus on one thing.
